If you feel you may have been

Parvovirus B19 (slapped 
cheek	disease)
Parvovirus B19 infection is 
common in children aged 
6–10.	It	causes	a	temperature	
and a characteristic red rash 
on the face, so it is often 
called ‘slapped cheek disease’.
Around	50–70%	of	women	
are immune to this infection. 
However, parvovirus B19 
is very infectious and can 
be harmful to your baby. If 
you come into contact with 
someone who is
